name: Pre-GT (Urgency 1)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for Giving Tuesday, I should go ahead and donate now
subject_prompt: Prompt people to create 5x more impact ahead of Giving Tuesday, e.g. Children Can’t Wait
key_message: Children Can’t Wait So Don’t Wait Until Tuesday to Donate
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/how-unicef-helps-malnourished-children-syria-moreis-story (Morei)
art_direction: See reference image–center individual child’s story & opportunity for impact (Doha can't wait)

name: Pre-GT (Cyber Monday)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for Giving Tuesday, I should go ahead and donate now
subject_prompt: Contrast the deal / sales language in people's inboxes
key_message: Online donations can make an offline impact for children.Focus on items that deliver for nutrition (RUTF), vaccination (vaccines) and education (desks / backpacks)
sources:
Item Based Stories Like:
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-delivers-children-caught-crises
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/defeating-polio-means-vaccinating-children-everywhere
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-reaching-children-gaza-lifesaving-therapeutic-food
art_direction: Focus on the items and goods we deliver to children around the world. Pictures of children + Items / boxes are key. Also see visual reference

name: Pre-GT (Urgency 2)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for Giving Tuesday, I should go ahead and donate now
subject_prompt: Prompt people to create 5x more impact ahead of Giving Tuesday, e.g. How Your 5x Match Changes Lives
key_message: Pre-empt waiting for Giving Tuesday and drive donors to donate now, getting involved early in the moment with the same match. Highlight categories of what UNICEF delivers to children around the world similar to: shelter, emergency relief and learning materials.
sources:
Stories of Impact:
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/global-reach-local-impact-unicef-delivering-every-child (paragraph at the bottom details concrete items delivered in multiple countries we can pull from to update framework at left)
art_direction: COUNTDOWN CLOCK TO GIVING TUESDAY- Focus on activities + items. The things we give.

name: Pre-GT (Urgency 3)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for Giving Tuesday, I should go ahead and donate now
subject_prompt: Dial up urgency among high propensity donors–change lives today
key_message: Children in Afghanistan can't wait for your help.
sources: Sources (Afghanistan overindexes for mass so will resonate with high propensity!)
art_direction: Reference image: Doha Can't Wait

name: Giving Tuesday (Urgency 1)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is here and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Start the clock, Highlight 5x match--for today only/just one more day, your donation could go five times as far.
key_message: Today, your gift means 5x more of what children need most: nutrition, vaccination, education. The clock is ticking; don't wait until midnight to give.
art_direction: Narrative appeal--100 words, longer form story telling, incorporate countdown clock

name: Giving Tuesday (Children Can't Wait)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is here and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Name a child (e.g. '<X> Can't Wait, Make a Gift Now') to make this email personal as an appeal during wider GT
key_message: Highlight that a child can't wait for your support on Giving Tuesday. Show a personal story / quote up top and then highlight the type of support we provide to children through additional quotes (e.g. Children like <y> need blankets this winter)
sources: Children's stories of support like:
art_direction: Lead with image of a child and a variation on the 'can't wait' line we've previously used. Where possible feature images that show humanity, kids being helped and make it hard to not want to help them, now on Giving Tuesday.

name: Giving Tuesday (Urgency 2)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is here and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Act Now for 5x the Impact--increase urgency from the morning, Today's the day
key_message: Highlight the urgency of support needed in Gaza. Palestinian families need aid and a lifeline this holiday. Time is running out to make your donation go 5x farther
sources: Gaza Specific (ensure langugage does make it unrestricted):https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-delivers-lifesaving-supplies-and-cash-transfers-families-gaza
art_direction: Reduce copy volume, no countdown clock, stick to blue buttons.

name: Giving Tuesday (Items Can't Wait)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is here and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Convey that "aid / items can't wait for kids who need them on Giving Tuesday'. Here we may not want to replicate 'can't wait' verbatim, but some version of it would be useful
key_message: Highlight that aid can't wait for your support, which helps it get delivered when needed. Show that on Giving Tuesday, the items we send are needed around the world - highlighting more items like vaccinations, RUTF, blankets and desks are needed and you can make it a reality today. We can't wait.
sources: Item focused communication leveraging the 'stimulus tab'
art_direction: Feature items

name: Giving Tuesday (Urgency 3)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is nearly over and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: 5x is running out / only a few hours left.
key_message: Giving Tuesday is nearly over--5x match message
sources: Countdown clock / match focused / Shorter.
art_direction: Graphic approach, no countdown clock, switch to red buttons and graphics with CTA.

name: Giving Tuesday (Urgency 4)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is nearly over and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Time is Running Out
key_message: Time is running out message--act now to give 5x impact
sources: Reinforcer of the 7 for HP audience
art_direction: Reintroduce countdown clock, graphic/visual focus with red buttons/ctas/cues

name: Giving Tuesday (Issues Send)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is nearly over and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Convey that the causes you care about can't wait, they need you now.
key_message: Last chance to give for 5x match
sources: Causes - Nutrition, Education Vaccination
art_direction: Shorten copy and make image led

time: STO (Only Email Going to this Group)
name: Thank You (GT Edition)
key_takeaway: Having donated recently, UNICEF USA recognizes that I've participated in supporting them early and in the spirit of days like today (Giving Tuesday)
subject_prompt: On Giving Tuesday, We Want to Thank You!
key_message: Highlight, simlar to the Thanksgiving thanks email, that recent donors have acted in the spirit of Giving Tuesday already. Include a potential written note and 1-2 examples of recent work  a donation like theirs supports
sources: Note + Recent Work
art_direction: Note + Examples. Small donation button at end with no real emphasis

name: Giving Tuesday (Urgency 5)
key_takeaway: Giving Tuesday is nearly over and its time to act to help support the causes I care about
subject_prompt: Your Last Chance
key_message: Final Chance, This is It, 5x Match
sources: Flashing Clock / Match is ending / time left / "Ending Tonight"
art_direction: Highly prominent countdown clock, graphic/visual focus with red buttons/ctas/cues--note, the strategy is the same as the previous urgency email, but we do want to make these look visually distinct enough to not set off spam filters for those receiving both--try different clock layouts, different photos, etc.

name: Post Giving Tuesday (K.I.N.D)
key_takeaway: You Can Still Support Children / There's Still Time to Support Children - Like those in Malawi Through K.I.N.D.
subject_prompt: You Can Still Help Children Get an Education--you can still give to KIND
key_message: Giving Tuesday is over but you can still help children learn - like those in Malawi through K.I.N.D. As MSNOW's Lawrence O'Donnell has highlighted, K.I.N.D. gives children desks for school, as well as scholarships for girls in Malawi. There's still time to donate so children like these can learn.  K.I.N.D. language
sources: K.I.N.D Stories like: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/kind-fund-helps-malawis-students-turn-dreams-reality
art_direction: a focus on stories of children from K.I.N.D.

name: Post GT 1 (Urgency Extended)
key_takeaway: You Can Still Support Children / There's Still Time to Support Children. Giving Tuesday is over but giving doesn't have to be.
subject_prompt: One More Chance for a 5x Match to Help Children Like XX KID NAME
key_message: Giving Tuesday is over but giving doesn't have to be. Make sure you make an end of year gift to support children like these.
sources:
Stories of children you can support like: 
Option 1: Raja
Option 2: Mohammed
Option 3: Kholoud
art_direction: Countdown clock in reverse and a focus on stories of children you can still help--demonstrate getting 24 hours back/24 more hours to get a 5x match

name: Post-GT 2
key_takeaway: You Can Still Support Children / There's Still Time to Support Children. Giving Tuesday is over but giving doesn't have to be.
subject_prompt: One More Chance to Give with 5x Match (Item Giving Focus)
key_message: Giving Tuesday is over, but giving doesn't have to be. Give today for one more chance to have your gift matched 5x, putting RUTFs, vaccines, and educational supplies on your holiday list.
sources:
Items your gift can support like: 
5x Nutrition: Lifesaving ready-to-use therapeutic food packets that help children beat life-threatening malnutrition 

5x Vaccination: Vaccines that help protect against deadly diseases 

5x Education: Desks, backpacks, and learning supplies that open doors to brighter futures
art_direction: NOcountdown clock. Items and extended 5x match language. The items are 'still available'

name: Post-GT HP (Urgency Extended)
key_takeaway: You Can Still Support Children / There's Still Time to Support Children. Giving Tuesday is over but giving doesn't have to.
subject_prompt: A FEW More Hours. Final Chance to Give.
key_message: The clock has been reset! FINAL CHANCE for a 5x donation match. Children can't wait.
sources: Lean into clock visuals/messaging from Giving Tuesday urgency sends. Similar approach but for the stragglers.
art_direction: Extended for today! 5x Match --losing time, clock disappearing

name: Impact Wrapped
key_takeaway: Highlight the impact a donation can create for children in numerical fashion,  mirroring the 'Spotify Wrapped' content many will get and post on social media for the year. We only have 2024 stats published in June, so 'unwrapping' what a donation can create vs. explicitly saying this is from 2025 is key.
subject_prompt: Reference "Your Impact Wrapped" Our something like that. We can't reference Spotify directly, but similarity will be good
key_message: Highlight the impact a donation can make across a range of issues
sources:
Stats Sourced from the previous annual report (published in June 2025 and referencing 2024) (Let's footnote that it's 2024 and instead say your donation contributes to work like this): 
- In 2024, 26 million out-of-school children andadolescents gained access to education (Education)
- UNICEF annually procures enough vaccines to reach 45 percent of the world’s under-5 children. (Vaccination)
- 251 million children under 5 were reached with early detection services for wasting - the most life- threatening form of malnutrition.
art_direction: Numerical stats / Tables and wrap up numbers that highlight all that we've done.

name: KIND 1
key_takeaway: K.I.N.D. helps gift children in Malawi an education one desk at a time
subject_prompt: Give Children an Education This Holiday Season - One Desk at a Time
key_message:
K.I.N.D. Helps provide desks to children in Malawi - an important aspect of learning.

1.) What is K.I.N.D.
2.) Why is a desk important - helps improve learning
3.) Story of Child given a desk 
K.I.N.D. language
sources: K.I.N.D Stories like: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/kind-fund-helps-malawis-students-turn-dreams-reality
art_direction: Very child focused - with pictures of classroom, desk and children learning

name: Postcard (Amanda Gorman)
key_takeaway: I'm inspired and uplifted by a sense of what's possible when I give
subject_prompt: A postcard from Amanda Gorman--highlight celeb focus & we deliver message
key_message: Provide a message of hope in the holiday season.  Imagine the world we could have [insert AG poem]--now let's make it a reality with your donation
sources:
Amanda Gorman Poem (WIP--final text will be confirmed before 12/2)
Poem Deck with more details & vids
August Postcard Email Creative 
other amanda vids for reference (winterization, RUTF, etc)
art_direction: Header image of kid from Amanda Gorman Poem  to drive appeal to donate + poem (FPO for now, text only NOT VIDEO) + image of Amanda and call to donate

name: KIND 2
key_takeaway: K.I.N.D. helps gift girls in Malawi an education one scholarship at a time
subject_prompt: Give Girls an Education This Holiday Season - One scholarship at a Time
key_message:
K.I.N.D. Helps provide scholarships to girls in Malawi - enabling learning

1.) What is K.I.N.D.
2.) The Scholarship covers all costs - enables girls to learn vs. risks of being out of learning
3.) Story of girl given a scholarship 
K.I.N.D. language
sources: K.I.N.D Stories like: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/kind-fund-helps-malawis-students-turn-dreams-reality
art_direction: Very child focused - with pictures of classroom, desk and children learning

key_takeaway: I should give now, add a donation to UNICEF to my holiday to do list
subject_prompt: Add a gift for children to your last minute holiday shopping list--children can't wait
key_message: Light tweaks to November send--dial up last minute holiday shopping & urgency. Change match to 5x

key_takeaway: I should give now, add a donation to UNICEF to my holiday to do list
subject_prompt: NA-resend
key_message: NA--resend

name: Newsletter
key_takeaway: UNICEF is achieving so much--and these efforts still need your support
subject_prompt: Illustrate how UNICEF is helping across several timely causes across the world--and how your support can help
key_message:
Focus on the top current issues and how UNICEF provides relief: 1) Cold/Winterization, 2) Emergency--Sudan Famine, 3) Gaza
Encourage Donation, plus 4) info about seeing if your employer will match your donation
sources:
Gaza stories like these: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/children-gaza-need-lifesaving-support

Sudan stories like these https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/explainer-what-famine and these https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/funding-cuts-deprive-hard-reach-children-essential-health-care

Cold and winterization stories like these and these https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/help-unicef-deliver-warmth-and-safety-winter and these https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-delivers-warmth-children-ukraine

can also pull gaza and winterization elements from impact stories like these https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-delivers-children-caught-crises

employer match info: landing page: https://www.unicefusa.org/about-unicef-usa/partnerships/companies/workplace-giving-and-employee-engagement/matching-gifts
art_direction: Follow past Newsletter approach-3 story modules, a 4th about employer matching, and a 5th about donation based on the above

name: Extreme Weather / Winterization 1
key_takeaway: Winter is here  & children can't wait
subject_prompt: Let Amanda Gorman show you how your gift helps ensure no child gets left in the cold this winter
key_message: Unbox a winterization kit with Amanda Gorman to see how your gift helps deliver essential cold-weather supplies for children in need. Help ensure no child is left in the cold this holiday season.
sources: Amanda Gorman Winterization Unboxing Video :30 and more winterization background here
art_direction: Amanda Gorman Unboxing Video (Have a few stills and link out to donate--can ask client ifi they are open to creating AG donate page)

name: Extreme Weather / Winterization 2
key_takeaway: I should give the gift of warmth to children in need this Christmas season
subject_prompt: This Christmas Eve, help keep children warm
key_message: Snow on Christmas sparks nostalgic memories for many of us, but for children in need, we need your help keeping them warm and safe. That's why UNICEF needs your help delivering cold weather aid in places like Afghanistan, Gaza, and Ukraine.
sources:
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/help-unicef-deliver-warmth-and-safety-winter (regional details across stories featured here)
delivering warmth in ukraine for winter 2025
art_direction: Christmas Eve / Keep Children Warm

name: EOY Primer [TAX 1]
key_takeaway: Informed about end of year giving, its impact and its tax benefit to them
subject_prompt: Your Last Gift of 2025 Can Help Children
key_message: End of Year Giving is important to help children in the coming year and may offer a tax benefit.  Mirror structure of linked article: why it matters (last gift of the year can be the first bit of hope for children in 2026, potential tax benefits, types of giving, CTA).
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/how-help/donate/end-of-year-giving
art_direction: Consider how we can break up the text heavy nature of this message with images or graphics

name: Match Intro
key_takeaway: I should donate now to maximize my giving this holiday.
subject_prompt: 5x Match Language--For a limited time, 5x match returns
key_message: Baseline: Introduce return of 5x match--before the year is up, help children like Zain
sources: Zain in Gaza from story tab
art_direction: big graphics, donation amounts, buttons, rather than long narratives or stat graphics.

name: EOY Match 1.1 (Urgency)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should donate now
subject_prompt: Prompt people to create 5x more impact in the final days of the year/four days to go--Children Can't Wait
key_message: Children Like Khalid (or similar) Can't Wait--Donate now for 5x the Impact
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 1
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
Pull from remaining/unused kids stories on stimulus tab--perhaps use Morei from Syria, since we replaced the early December Morei email with Sudan: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/how-unicef-helps-malnourished-children-syria-moreis-story (Morei)
art_direction: visualize urgency--clock or calendar to highlight time running out on our EOY 5x match. this will be our first touchpoint in a series of urgency messaging--so lean into the blue cues and a bit more text, ramping up from here (use giving tuesday urgency approach as a guide)

name: EOY Match 1.2 (Issues) / Education
key_takeaway: A last gift of the season to children can help improve their new year, through aid that supports and educates them
subject_prompt: Education Can Help Make 2026 a Good Year for Children. 5x Match
key_message: Education can ensure a better 2026 for children. UNICEF works to provide access to education for children across the world. A donation today will be matched, ensuring your last gift of 2025 is 5x more.
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/lifeline-education-children-syria
art_direction: Story is the focus on Mohammed

name: EOY Match 2.1 (LIAM NEESON 1)
key_takeaway: I should give now to help end hunger/malnutrition
subject_prompt: Your Gift Delivers 5x the Nutrition for Children in Need
key_message: Personal appeal/ Dispatch from Sudan:   In places like Sudan, with your help, UNICEF delivers lifesaving nutrition to children. No child should die from hunger or malnutrition--through 12/31, your gift is 5x matched. NB: We want to speak more broadly than just Sudan, as so far this issue hasn't driven donations--can acknolwedge his presence there and expand upon it to others
sources:
2024 Liam Neeson Email
2025 Liam Neeson Videos & Statics (especially RUTF video)
art_direction: Personal address/letter. Can mirror last year examples with postcard, but note we only have assets of him in one location, Sudan, and do want to make this issue feel broader than JUST Sudan!

name: Urgency HP Touch 1
key_takeaway: I should give now--time is running out
subject_prompt: Children LIke Norpia Need Your Help--5x Match
key_message: Time is running out--children are in urgent need and your gift can make a difference
sources: Norpia (or similar) from a recent story like this one: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/measles-cases-are-soaring-globally-heres-what-you-need-know
art_direction: big graphics, donation amounts, buttons, rather than long narratives or stat graphics.

name: EOY Match 3.1 (TAX MESSAGE)
key_takeaway: A donation to UNICEF before the end of the year doesn't just benefit children, it may help me more as well.
subject_prompt: Year End Giving Matters - Find Out Why
key_message: There are lots of ways to give to support UNICEF and doing it before the end of the year may have additional benefits (Tax Benefit + Ways To Give)
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/how-help/donate/end-of-year-giving
art_direction: Dialling in on the middle bit of the article. Shorter than primer mirroring what a lot of other sends at this time are doing (shortening)

name: Urgency HP Touch 2
key_takeaway: I should give now--time is running out

art_direction: big graphics, donation amounts, buttons, rather than long narratives or stat graphics.

key_takeaway: I should give now--time is running out
subject_prompt: Time Is Running Out--Suport Children Like Faustina (or similar)
key_message: Lean into Faustina's story of girls overcoming challenges to drive urgency of 5x match--time is running out to help children like Faustina

name: EOY Match 4.1 (URGENCY)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Children Everywhere Like XX Can't Wait (2 Days Left of 5x Match)
key_message: Children this year have experienced incredible hardships--donate now for a 5x match to ensure a brighter 2026 (focus on story of 1 child to help drive emotinoal connection)
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 2
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
art_direction: Mirror Giving Tuesday Touchpoint 2, begin to slightly dial up urgency

name: EOY Match 4.2 (NEW YEAR EMOTIONAL MESSAGE)
key_takeaway: When I think about new years resolutions and what I want out of 2026, a better world for children should be part of that consideration set
subject_prompt: A New Year for Children in Need
key_message: As 2025 comes to a close and you shift into festive mode, resolve to make the  most of the last chance you have this year to help children. Because the best version of 2026 is one in which kids like these can thrive.
sources: Pull from June Impact Report2024 2024
art_direction: Feature photos and stories of individual children, look ahead

name: EOY Match 4.3 (Issues) (Gaza)
key_takeaway: A New Year for Gaza's Children Can Come From You
subject_prompt: Help Make 2026 A Year of Recovery for Gaza's Children. [5x Match]
key_message: Gaza's children have a long road to recovering their future in 2026. A gift before the year ends can help children like those in Gaza stay healthy, warm and educated for the year ahead (overview of Gaza efforts and stories of vaccination, nutrition, warmth and education)
sources:
https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/ceasefire-brings-hope-gazas-children

https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/help-unicef-deliver-warmth-and-safety-winter
art_direction: Feature stories of 1-2 children's hope for Gaza

name: Urgency HP Touch 4
key_takeaway: I should give now--time is running out
subject_prompt: Our EOY 5x Match is Nearly Over--Children Suffering from Malnutrition Can't Wait
key_message: Time is running out. Pull from Sudan/malnutrition stories in stories tab, with low/medium complexity message and single image. Let's keep the message related to malnutrition vs to Sudan.
sources: Pull from Sudan/malnutrition stories in stories tab
art_direction: countdown clock, low to medium complexity, animatios to drive urgency

name: EOY Match 4.4 (ISSUES) (Nutrition)
key_takeaway: A last gift for children in 2025, can fight malnutrition in 2026
subject_prompt: UNICEF is helping children overcome malnutrition in 2026, will you?
key_message: UNICEF is helping fight famine around the world and in places like Yemen, where our work helps to provide nutrition to children. With your help, we can keep providing aid to children in 2026.
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/hope-wheels-unicef-mobile-teams-save-lives-yemen
art_direction: Show the work done in Yemen to help children as a way to humanize the issue. Showcase one or more children in images from the article.

key_message: Children this year have experienced incredible hardships--donate now for a 5x match to ensure a brighter 2026 (focus on story of 1 child to help drive emotinoal connection)

 Giving Tuesday WIP Emails

key_message: Children in Gaza can't wait for your help.

name: EOY Match 5.1 (URGENCY)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Highlight 5x match--for today only/just one more day, your donation could go five times as far.
key_message: Today, your gift means 5x more of what children need most: nutrition, vaccination, education. The clock is ticking; don't wait until midnight to give.

Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 4
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
art_direction: Narrative appeal--100 words, longer form story telling, incorporate countdown clock

name: EOY Match 5.2 (ISSUES) (Winterization)
key_takeaway: We're working to keep children warm on New Year's Day and throughout the year.  A last 2025 gift to UNICEF helps them keep children safe in 2026. I need to donate now
subject_prompt: Make 2026 5x More Safe and Warm for Children
key_message: UNICEF is working to keep children warm and safe this winter. Donate now to help children in the new year with 5x match
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/unicef-delivers-warmth-children-ukraine
art_direction: Highlight how UNICEF is keeping children warm and safe this winter. Tell the story of a child we've helped. Highlight the items we provide (Story / Item).  Shorter length is ok. 1 child story is good.

name: EOY Match 5.3 (URGENCY)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Clock is ticking--donate now to send 5x the support
key_message: 5x is running out, only a few hours left
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 5
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
art_direction: Countdown clock / match focused / Shorter.

name: EOY Match 5.4 (LIAM NEESON)
key_takeaway: I should give tonight to help make a difference in a child's life
subject_prompt: Donate to Save a Child's Life--5x Match is Running Out
key_message: Every donation makes a difference--"I've seen it, I've felt it, and I believe in it more than ever." Nod to 5x match but lean on celeb tie in and emotional/human impact of Liam's story
sources:
2024 Liam Neeson Email
2025 Liam Neeson Videos & Statics (especially human centered video)
art_direction: Can follow last year's approach--letter, center images of Liam Neeson, children, UNICEF workers, parents

name: Urgency HP Touch 5
key_takeaway: I should give now--time is running out
subject_prompt: Time Is Running Out on 5x Match--ACT TONIGHT
key_message: 5x is running out, only a few hours left
sources: Mirror Giving Tuesday evening emails--goal animation, low complexity, single photo
art_direction: Lowest complexity, include goal animation, graphics, red, buttons

name: EOY Match 5.5 (NEW YEAR EMOTIONAL MESSAGE)
key_takeaway: Emotional impact of giving as you prepare for 2026
subject_prompt: Don't wait for the clock to strike to help shape the world you want to see in 20206
key_message: On the final day of 2025, plant the seed for the world you want in 2026 with a donation to support children, 5x matched between now and midnight.
sources:
2024 Impact Stats (these are the latest we've got!)
stories of impact like:
Warmth in Ukraine
art_direction: Slightly more narrative than urgency emails but leaning into red, photos of children, etc.

name: EOY Urgency NOR Resend 7 Am Email
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Highlight 5x match--for today only/just one more day, your donation could go five times as far.
key_message: Today, your gift means 5x more of what children need most: nutrition, vaccination, education. The clock is ticking; don't wait until midnight to give.
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 4
 Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
art_direction: Narrative appeal--100 words, longer form story telling, incorporate countdown clock

name: EOY Match 5.6 (URGENCY)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Dial up the urgency in the final stretch & simplify the action, underscore 5x match
key_message: Don't let the year end without giving back--tonight's your last chance to make a donation that goes 5x further for children in need (mirror Shannon's table with 3 buttons shared last week, breaking out action into simplified cta button--simplify the action)
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 5
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
Stories Tab
art_direction: Specific breakdown of donation amounts through CTA buttons {see 2024 example }

name: EOY Match 5.7 (ISSUES) (Education)
key_takeaway: A last minute gift to UNICEF in 2025 can make a long term impact for children.
subject_prompt: Help children learn and thrive in 2026
key_message: UNICEF works to keep children safe and educated around the world, unlocking a greater future for them. Your gift today can help children thrive next year and beyond.
sources: https://www.unicefusa.org/stories/back-school-sudan-hope-backpack
art_direction: Show the story of Anfal or Tawasol from the article. Shorter copy, image led

name: EOY Match 5.8 (URGENCY)
key_takeaway: I shouldn't wait for the New Year--I should give now
subject_prompt: Final chance--one hour left of our final 5x match for 2025
key_message: One more hour to make your imapct go 5x farther--make your donation NOW
sources:
Mirror Giving Tuesday Urgency Touchpoint 5
Giving Tuesday WIP Emails
art_direction: Ultimate urgency--mirror last hours of Giving Tuesday, highly visual, lots of red

time: STO (Only Email Going to this Group)
name: Thank You (EOY Edition)
key_takeaway: Having donated recently, UNICEF USA recognizes that I've participated in supporting them early and in the spirit of times like right now--End of Year gifting season
subject_prompt: At the end of 2025, We Want to Thank You!
key_message:
Highlight, simlar to the Thanksgiving thanks email and GT thank you email that recent donors have acted in the spirit of the season already. Include a potential written note and 1-2 examples of recent work a donation like theirs supports
Giving Tuesday Thank You Email
sources: Note + Recent Work
art_direction: Note + Examples. Small donation button at end with no real emphasis
